blocks.name: cplig
blocks.content: Extend class notation with the class of all planar incidence geometries.

blocks.name: df-plig
blocks.content: Define the class of planar incidence geometries. We use Hilbert's axioms and adapt them to planar geometry. We use ` e. ` for the incidence relation. We could have used a generic binary relation, but using ` e. ` allows us to reuse previous results. Much of what follows is directly borrowed from Aitken, _Incidence-Betweenness Geometry_, 2008, ~ http://public.csusm.edu/aitken_html/m410/betweenness.08.pdf . The class ` Plig ` is the class of planar incidence geometries, where a planar incidence geometry is defined as a set of lines satisfying three axioms. In the definition below, ` x ` denotes a planar incidence geometry, so ` U. x ` denotes the union of its lines, that is, the set of points in the plane, ` l ` denotes a line, and ` a , b , c ` denote points. Therefore, the axioms are: 1) for all pairs of (distinct) points, there exists a unique line containing them; 2) all lines contain at least two points; 3) there exist three non-collinear points. (Contributed by FL, 2-Aug-2009.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-plig(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  |- wceq(cplig, cab(s0, w3a(wral(s1, cuni(cv(s0)), wral(s2, cuni(cv(s0)), wi(wne(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wreu(s3, cv(s0), wa(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s3)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s3))))))), wral(s3, cv(s0), wrex(s1, cuni(cv(s0)), wrex(s2, cuni(cv(s0)), w3a(wne(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s3)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s3)))))), wrex(s1, cuni(cv(s0)), wrex(s2, cuni(cv(s0)), wrex(s4, cuni(cv(s0)), wral(s3, cv(s0), wn(w3a(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s3)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s3)), wcel(cv(s4), cv(s3)))))))))))
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
}

thm ispligb(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wb(wcel(c0, cplig), wa(wcel(c0, universe), w3a(wral(s0, c1, wral(s1, c1, wi(wne(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wreu(s2, c0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s2))))))), wral(s2, c0, wrex(s0, c1, wrex(s1, c1, w3a(wne(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s2)))))), wrex(s0, c1, wrex(s1, c1, wrex(s3, c1, wral(s2, c0, wn(w3a(wcel(cv(s0), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s3), cv(s2)))))))))))
  -| wceq(c1, cuni(c0))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsc(s3, c0)
  -| diffsc(s3, c1)
} = {
  biadanii(wcel(c0, cplig), wcel(c0, universe), w3a(wral(s0, c1, wral(s1, c1, wi(wne(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wreu(s2, c0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s2))))))), wral(s2, c0, wrex(s0, c1, wrex(s1, c1, w3a(wne(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s2)))))), wrex(s0, c1, wrex(s1, c1, wrex(s3, c1, wral(s2, c0, wn(w3a(wcel(cv(s0), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s3), cv(s2))))))))))
  elex(c0, cplig)
  isplig(s0, s1, s2, s3, c0, universe, c1)
}

blocks.name: tncp

blocks.name: pliguhgr
blocks.content: Any planar incidence geometry ` G ` can be regarded as a hypergraph with its points as vertices and its lines as edges. See ~ incistruhgr for a generalization of this case for arbitrary incidence structures (planar incidence geometries are such incidence structures). (Proposed by Gerard Lang, 24-Nov-2021.) (Contributed by AV, 28-Nov-2021.)
